ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take this class if you want to do anything in the field of medicine/biology/physiology. It starts from the very basics and gives a very comprehensive overview of all the imaging modalities, how to use them and when to use them.

I thought this class was useful for being exposed to current works at Yale in neuroimaging, but I felt we could have gone into more technical detail for it to be useful for me. A lot of this material could have been found in a review, but it was nice to hear it explained.
This is a great course to get an in depth overview of neuroimaging and neuropsychiatric disease. I would definitely recommend it to others.

I would summarize this course as a broad overview of some of the key imaging modalities used in psychiatric research. I would recommend this course because I feel that I learned a lot about imaging, a topic I knew little about prior to taking the course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Honestly? None. I wasn't taking it for that reason though. I just wanted to expand my knowledge on this area.
This course covered material outside of my research, but I learned a tremendous amount about neuroimaging techniques and the current research ongoing in the Yale community.
